name: Boulder Mountain Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just got back from a weekend stay at the Boulder Mountain Lodge, and I couldn't be more positive! The staff were warm and friendly, the rooms were clean and beautiful. What a wonderful little oasis in the middle of the red rock desert! Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Incredible Place to Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at the Boulder Mtn. Lodge, once before, with visiting out of state friends. I recently received an email promotion from then for a 2nd. night 1/2 off. My husband and I love that area so took advantage of it with a planned 2 night stay turning into 3.
reviews.title: Even better than the first visit.

reviews.text: The 1st. visit I was in a 2nd floor, 2 bdrm. suite in the main building with central community area.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting

reviews.text: This time we had our dog with us (love pet friendly properties) so we were in one of their 1st. floor rooms in the building further down the drive, towards the Burr Trail. Our 2 queen room was large, spotless, nicely decorated with wonderful mattresses, the softest bedding, large, thick terry cloth towels and robes for the hot tub.
reviews.title: Lovely location on our way to visit Bryce Canyon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love the amenity of screen doors that allow the inside front and rear doors to remain open for a nice breeze, the adirondack chairs on the patio, overlooking the large grassy lawn, pastures and mountains beyond, the beautiful tubs of overflowing flowers, the elegant rustic design, waterfowl preserve, and large outdoor kitchen in the hot tub patio for BBQ's and picnics.
reviews.title: Great Find

reviews.text: We love this place. We last visited 9 years ago and it is even better than we remember. The rooms are spacious and clean. It is in a beautiful, relaxing setting with plenty of nearby activities. The lodge is family friendly and there are plenty of lawn games for the kids to choose from. Every meal we had at Hell's Backbone was amazing. We look forward to our next visit.
reviews.title: We will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lodge was the perfect stopping point after leaving Capitol Reef National Park. We had a king room overlooking the lake and bird sanctuary. The room was spacious and comfortable. There is great detail put into every aspect of the property. The on site restaurant was incredible. Just like the property, great detail was put into each dish they served. Every bite was absolutely delicious. Boulder Mountain Lodge did not disappoint. I will find an excuse to return and stay longer than one night.
reviews.title: A Hidded Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This ecologically-minded lodge is set on beautiful grounds. We stayed in a building with rooms overlooking a lovely field; another building has rooms that overlook the establishment's own lake and bird sanctuary and we often spent time in the great room there enjoying the view. The restaurant on the grounds in absolutely outstanding, with organic gourmet food that is absolutely fresh and well-prepared. And there you are, minutes away from spectacular hiking and scenery!
reviews.title: Beautiful, serene, ecofriendly--and food to die for

reviews.text: The lodge was peaceful, quiet and in the perfect spot for sightseeing in all directions. The rooms
reviews.title: Excellent Stay - Wonderful Scenery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: are clean and neat and (2 queens) have lots of space for luggage and stuff. Our 2 rooms overlooked a nice bird viewing lake with ducks, geese with babies, coots, blackbirds, etc. It was
reviews.title: Excellent -- worth a (long) detour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is really the perfect place. A cozy lodge in a beautiful valley surrounded by a vast variety of activities ranging from leisure to hardcore adventure! The restaurant on site (Hell’s BackboneGrill; see separate review) is top notch. The rooms are clean and beyond adequate. Short of finding a Four Seasons this is absolutely the best you are going to find in a town with a population of 200. The staff is helpful, the grounds are beautiful, the wifi is free. Life is good. This is THE place to stay in the area. We stayed 3 nights in room 7.
reviews.title: Cozy retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just down the road are hikes for Calf Creek Falls (upper and lower), The Escalante River (upper and lower), Hole in the Rock Road (Devil’s Garden, Spooky and Peek-a-boo Gulch, Etc.
reviews.title: Lovely place, great location, super restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at BML. It was ok, it's rustic in style. The room layout was a little weird but it worked and was clean. We slept well in a comfortable bed and had no issues at all. There is a hot tub which we didn't try. The grounds of the hotel are lovely. We ate at the HBG for dinner and breakfast.
reviews.title: Weekend in the desert.

reviews.text: We have stayed at the Boulder Mountain Lodge a number of times. Each stay is peaceful and restoring. We especially enjoy having a room that overlooks the bird sanctuary. Everyone one is welcoming and helpful.
reviews.title: Nice hotel to use for launching point
Glad We Finally Made It
reviews.text: This hotel is in a beautiful area. Lots of hiking, fishing, exploring, or just enjoying the beautiful Highway 12 scenery. The hotel is in good shape and has a bit of a rustic feel to it. There are 3 restaurants on-site. 1 is basically a deli, 1 is basically your classic american food restaurant, and the 3rd is a fine dining restaurant. We ate at the Devil's Backbone grill (fine dining) and the food was excellent. My parents-in-law at the classic american food restaurant (I can't remember what it was called), and loved it. They ate there twice. The grounds are meticulously kept. There is a very large, well kept hot tub, and a common area in one of the lodges. The office has a bunch of outdoor games and toys available for visitors to use on their spacious grounds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Perfect location for exploring Escalante National Parks slot canyons. Hell's Backbone Restaurant is excellent. The drive down Burr Trail road is close and beautiful. Rooms are lovely and very comfortable. Nancy and Bill
reviews.title: Wonderful Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights as were were hiking in the area. Our room (#18), was a corner room, so we had two doors, one on each side, so it provided a great cross breeze. The room overlooked a nice lawn area, although the we did see the back of the employee housing as well as a stored tent and some random equipment. It didn't obscure our view. The room was very comfortable, air conditioning worked well, and the nice front porch with two chairs was a nice touch. Now for the negatives- the check-in process was very efficient, but not too friendly, which surprised me. Another negative, and this is a pet peeve, is that half the hangers were of the type that you couldn't remove from the pole, so they must not trust their guests much. For a lodge of this reputation, calibre and cost, this was a ridiculous feature in their closet. Perhaps they should take a page out of a Best Western manual. All in all, it was a relaxing stay, in an out of the way, area. Would we stay here again---yes, as it's good, as well as being the only game in town.
reviews.title: Overall, a very pleasant place to stay, with one caveat

reviews.text: There are just some places you need to experience in life and Boulder Mountain Lodge is one of them. We rolled in late from biking and a hike in a slot canyon. Had just enough time to shower with the wonderful Aveda products, dress up and make our 6:45 dinner reservation at Hell's Backbone Grill. Where the food is spectacular and I've been a chef in a four star restaurant so trust me. Service was crisp, relaxed and extremely personal. Wait staffs' knowledge of the menu was spot on. All food and drink came at the right pace and presentation was beautiful. There were flowers on our food! From the Filet, to the Pork Tenderloin Chop w/home grown stone fruit sauce, salads and the most incredible blend of tastes from a carrot soup with chive olive oil and flower buds. The staff held our bill open while we went for a walk and played badminton to work up room for desert. All 4 deserts we choose were fabulous with the hot fudge sundae with meringue getting the best off, with strawberry shortcake and lemon chiffon cake a close second. Quick change into our suits and spent the last half hour of tub time before the kicked us out at 10:00PM. I set the alarm to wake up at 12:45 to be able to sit on our balcony and drink in the stars. A near perfect evening. Forget about the money and experience a perfect night of food and relaxation.
reviews.title: Expensive, but not when you meet the staff and you're treated like an old friend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a rather noisy room. Room 7 is on the ground floor closest to the kitchen exhaust fans and associated backdoor kitchen smells and noises. Bottles being dumped at 1030pm while we were lying in bed. Also, while the bird sanctuary is quite amazing, the geese were honking loudly at 6am!
reviews.title: Nice place in Boulder but

reviews.text: Check in was efficient but not overly friendly. The area "expert" they had stationed in the lodge was a nice touch except that he did not offer much insight into anything and was rather indifferent. The overall setting is fantastic, this is a place to return to.
reviews.title: Great Lodge, Very Peaceful

description: Boulder Mountain Lodge is located in the middle of Utah’s scenic red rock canyon country. This nationally recognized luxury lodge provides everything for a fabulous getaway - spacious rooms, intimate ambiance, unparalleled views, fine dining, and an impressive array of services and amenities. There is not a better setting for your family vacation, meeting, reunion, or romantic getaway. The Lodge is the home of the award winning Hell's Backbone Grill.
